• Full Time
  • McLean, Virginia
  • Posted 2 weeks ago
Login to bookmark this Job

Position Summary: The Data Analyst will work in support of a contract which provides a comprehensive suite of software products encompassing data warehousing, to analysis, to end-user software. These products cover many functional and operational areas and support large numbers of concurrent users. Business casual work environment with exposure to cutting-edge technologies.

Scope: Works as a member of a team. No budgetary responsibilities.

Essential Functions of the Position:

  • Reviews, evaluates, designs, implements and maintains SQL databases. Identifies data sources, constructs data decomposition diagrams, provides data flow diagrams and documents the process. Performs requirements analyses
  • Interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
  • Acquires data and maintains databases/data systems
  • Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filters and “cleans” data, and reviews computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Locates and define new process improvement opportunities
  • Writes codes for database access, modifications, and constructions including stored procedures.
  • Has expertise with a variety of the field’s concepts, practices, and procedures.
  • Typically reports to a project leader or project manager
  • May perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • BS/BA in area of specialty and 3 or more years of experience in the field or in a related area. A combination of 4 additional years of education, technical training and equivalent experience may be substituted for the bachelor’s degree.
  • Experience with SQL environment and reporting tools.
  • Security+ preferred.
  • Ability to work with a team environment.
  • Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills required.
  • US Citizenship is required and must be able to pass a background investigation in order to gain access to the client site and computer systems.

Additional Skills:

  • Microsoft certification preferred.

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

  • Usual office working conditions.
  • Required to sit for long periods of time using a personal computer.
  • Some light physical effort required.
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position

Work Location: McLean, Virginia

Travel: Possible limited local travel.
